episode: I only see my baby grother (who is 65 years old) a few times a year, and I was looking forward to the two of us attending the state Libertarian Convention in Oklahoma City.  But a few days before, he told me he was in chemo and too fatigued for the trip.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: My brother is in chemo.  The doctors found a cancerous mole, and he has a lump on his esophagus.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: I'm so sorry to hear that. That sounds really tough for him.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: They give him something for nausea, but he is fatigued all the time.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That must be really frustrating for him.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: It is.  He has people from church and other friends to check on him, nut he misses doing things.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It's hard to lose that sense of independence and normalcy.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: The two of us planned to attend the state LP convention in Oklahoma City, but he just isn't up for the trip.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's really disappointing for both of you, I'm sure.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yes, we only see each other three or four times a year anyway, and this is one of them.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: So it's a big miss for you both, especially since you don't get to see each other often.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Exactly, that and I'm worried about him.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Of course, that's natural, he's your brother and you care about him.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: The docs say his prognosis is excellent, and he should be cancer free by summer.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's great news, something to hold onto and look forward to.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: it would be, if I entirely believed it.  But docs have been wrong before.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's a lot of uncertainty to deal with, it's hard to shake off the doubts.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yes.  I attended the convention, and everyone else is worried too.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It's good that you have a supportive community that cares about him too.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yes, everyone is sending him texts, telling him to hurry up and get better.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's really sweet, I'm sure it means a lot to him.
